title: Feminism and Futurity: New Times, New Spaces
abstractText:
This seminar series is designed to stimulate debate over the possibilities for thinking feminist futures that will supplement or even displace those of linear progression and inheritance underwriting pessimistic prognoses of feminism's passing. These insights of feminist scholarship are reflected in the organisation of the seminar series across the domains of:

  • economy
  • governance
  • community
  • nature
  • life.

In all these fields, recognition of multiple conceptions of time and space generated by feminist analyses creates new possibilities for re-imagining taken-for-granted conceptions of time and space more broadly.
